newsitem.title: USA: GPU NJ Oyster Creek seen on line Wed - NRC.
newsitem.headline: GPU NJ Oyster Creek seen on line Wed - NRC.

text.p: General Public Utilities Corp's (GPU) 610 megawatt (MW) Oyster Creek nuclear power station is expected to be back on line Wednesday, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) said on Tuesday.
The plant's Monday startup from refueling was delayed by a steam leak on a reheater, the NRC said.
Oyster Creek technicians "plan to start pulling control rods again today, and place the unit on line tomorrow," NRC said in its Tuesday status report.
GPU officials could not be immediately reached to confirm the restart schedule.
The Forked River, N.J., plant was shut September 4 to repair a low main condensor vacuum. The outage was extended to include refueling and maintenance.
